item.title: Report I-2024090073
item.description:
Report I-2024090073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the top side of the pail putting a 3 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2024100013
item.description:
Report E-2024100013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024 at 0454 ET, an XPO Logistics tractor trailer was exiting I-85 SB onto W.T. Harris Blvd in Charlotte, NC, when the unit rolled over. As a result of the accident (4) 275-gallon poly totes were structurally damaged but still in tact. On September 18, 2024, XPO Logistics in Mississauga, ON notified ERTS of the four totes sitting on their dock needing a transfer. The tote were originally to ship onto the consignee, however the shipper and consignee confirmed the totes needed to be disposed of. ERTS dispatched contractors with specialty totes to complete the transfer of all 4 totes into new ones on September 21, 2024. The crew confirmed there was approximately 1-teaspoon of dried product on the tote body as a result of the roll over accident. All product was successfully transferred from the damaged totes into new ones with no further incident or release. The waste was staged onsite at XPO in Mississauga for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090569
item.description:
Report E-2024090569

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 18, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon jugs of UN3149 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed sodium bicarbonate and absorbents pads to neutralize and remediate the impacted trailer. All unaffected product was re-stacked and re-wrapped and staged onsite for further processing and shipping. The damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum

item.title: Report E-2024090519
item.description:
Report E-2024090519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, at 1148 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Charlotte, North Carolina regarding the release of Champion Muriatic Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 gallon of Champion Muriatic Acid (UN1789, Hydrochloric Acid, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon poly jug. The release was caused by a multi vehicle accident and impacted the cardboard packaging of other cargo, the trailer floor, and a 1ft x 5ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. The local fire department solidified the release in the trailer, then contractors neutralized the asphalt, the trailer floor, and the impacted cardboard boxes. The undamaged cargo inside impacted boxes were unboxed, then wrapped and repalletized. Contractors then cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DFs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024090056
item.description:
Report I-2024090056

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: Polkton
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was filling the trailer at the Polkton yard. He thought the capacitly of the was 2,500 gallons, but it was actualy 2,000 gallon. He was right by the load wataching it as it filled and as soon as it started to overflow he turned it off. The loading area is in contaiment and the spill was quiclky cleaned up by the site with no exposure or injury.
